instructions: Preheat the oven to 475°F (245°C). Roll out the pizza dough on a floured surface. Spread tomato sauce over the dough, leaving a small border. Sprinkle mozzarella cheese evenly over the sauce. Top with fresh basil leaves and drizzle with olive oil. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until the crust is golden and the cheese is bubbly. Serve hot.
servingSuggestion: Pair with a simple green salad.

instructions: Heat sesame oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add garlic and ginger, and cook for 1 minute. Add all the vegetables and stir-fry for 5-7 minutes until tender-crisp. Add tofu if using, and stir to combine. Pour soy sauce over the vegetables and stir well. Cook for an additional 2 minutes. Serve hot.
servingSuggestion: Serve over steamed rice or noodles.

instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). In a large bowl, cream together the butter, sugar, and brown sugar until smooth. Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the vanilla. Combine the flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt; gradually blend into the creamed mixture. Stir in the chocolate chips. Drop by rounded spoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown. Let cool on wire racks.
servingSuggestion: Serve with a glass of cold milk.

instructions: In a large bowl, combine cherry tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, olives, and feta cheese. Drizzle olive oil and red wine vinegar over the salad. Season with salt and pepper and toss to combine. Serve immediately.

On a serving plate, arrange alternating slices of tomatoes and mozzarella. Scatter fresh basil leaves on top. Drizzle olive oil and balsamic vinegar over the salad. Season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

In a pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onion and garlic, and sauté until softened. Add diced tomatoes and vegetable broth, and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes. Add fresh basil leaves, season with salt and pepper, and blend until smooth. Serve hot.
servingSuggestion: Serve with a side of garlic bread.

instructions: Cook spaghetti according to package instructions. In a pan, cook pancetta until crispy. Add garlic and sauté for 1 minute. In a bowl, whisk eggs and Parmesan cheese together. Drain pasta and add to the pan with pancetta. Remove from heat and quickly mix in the egg mixture. Season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.
servingSuggestion: Serve with a sprinkle of extra Parmesan cheese.

instructions: In a large pan, heat sesame oil over medium heat. Add chicken and cook until browned. Add garlic and ginger, and sauté for 1 minute. Add broccoli, bell pepper, and snap peas, and cook until tender. Stir in soy sauce and honey, and cook for another 2 minutes. Serve hot.
In a bowl, mix mashed avocado with lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Spread the avocado mixture on toasted bread slices. Sprinkle with red pepper flakes. Serve immediately.
servingSuggestion: Top with a poached egg for added protein.

instructions: In a pan, cook ground beef over medium heat until browned. Add taco seasoning and water as directed on the package, and simmer until thickened. Fill taco shells with beef, lettuce, tomatoes, cheese, and sour cream. Serve immediately.

ingredients: 1 cup fresh or frozen mango chunks
instructions: In a blender, combine mango chunks, Greek yogurt, orange juice, honey, and turmeric. Blend until smooth. Pour into a glass and serve immediately.
servingSuggestion: Garnish with a slice of fresh mango or mint leaves.

instructions: Cook ground beef in a skillet over medium heat until browned. Add taco seasoning and water according to the packet instructions. Simmer until thickened. Warm taco shells in the oven. Fill each shell with beef, lettuce, cheese, salsa, and a dollop of sour cream. Serve immediately.
servingSuggestion: Serve with a side of Mexican rice and refried beans.

instructions: In a large pan, heat sesame oil over medium heat. Add garlic and ginger, and sauté for 1 minute. Add broccoli, carrots, snap peas, and bell pepper, and stir fry until tender-crisp. Add soy sauce and rice vinegar, and cook for another 2 minutes. Serve hot.
servingSuggestion: Serve over quinoa or brown rice.

instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). In a mixing bowl, combine mashed bananas and melted butter. Add sugar, egg, and vanilla extract, and mix well. Stir in baking soda, .
servingSuggestion: Serve with a dollop of whipped cream or butter.
